page.title: 13HOUSING.
page.content: Most houses in the area are privately owned, with some rented or tied estate cottages. Some older houses are large but with much infilling in gardens: others have been replaced by 'closes' of small properties. Many smaller old houses and cottages have been gentrified. All have mains water and electricity, some gas; a few still have septic tanks. Good communications and a situation midway between Heathrow & Gatwick have caused a big middle class influx & hence inflated prices. Houses range from Tudor to mod -ern, all well maintained and most of a pleasing traditional type. Ripley has a high proportion of listed build- ings. Pyrford contains a permanent caravan site of 100 units, which may be enlarged. There is a shortage of low price houses for first-time buyers and the elderly.
